name: dropkickpikachu
text: Man beef is so crestfallen. Also the fact that Beef hears exactly what Philippe says is a stroke of genius.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Did Philipe ever actually get that piano music?

name: relaxing
text: Did he get taken off the Capital One mailing list?

name: slalvation
text:
there is no capital one mailing list.

there is only your dead friends in hell.

name: relaxing
text: I wish dead friends in hell would stop trying to sell me credit protection plans.

name: rainwolfj
text:
You know, now that I think about it, everytime a friend dies I seem to get a lot of telemarketer calls...

This idea goes deeper than we know...

name: theguitarhero
text:
That's sad though.

All your dead friends went to hell.

name: rainwolfj
text: Anyone who isn't hellbound isn't worth hanging out with.

name: evilbobikus
text: Sadly most of my friends would just call me even more after realizing this.

name: actualtaunt
text: Avatar-comment Synergy!

name: saint
text: I hear Satan throws a wicked rave.

name: relaxing
text: This is one of my top 5 all-time assetbar comments.

name: canusdivinus
text:
Capital One sent my dead grandfather a credit card application. He'd been dead EIGHTEEN FUCKING YEARS.

It all makes sense now.

name: invidious
text:
What's in your wallet?

Hm. Portable doorway to hell, evidently.

(Hint: portable doorway to hell = portable doorway to immense credit card debt = exact same thing!)

name: shutup_shutup
text: There is no Dana only Capital One.

name: natashamarie
text: At first I didn't get this one.  About a week later I started laughing hysterically for 5 minutes in the shower.  My family was concerned.

name: scrumpton
text: Your family watch you shower?

name: soticoto
text: That ranks up in the top five most awesome counter-comments ever.

name: woodenteeth
text: Who are you, Letterman?

name: soticoto
text: I'm Spartacus.

name: woodenteeth
text: Oh shit... lucky I'm not near a well.

name: snowman
text: I know you probably didn't put that much thought into this comment, and I'm honestly not trying to be a dick about it, but really picture someone laughing hysterically for five minutes.  Nothing is that funny.

name: tekende
text: Especially when the thing they're laughing about is not actually present.

name: nutmeg
text: A comment left by nutmeg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rolotonybrowntown, _cheesekayke, footslogga)

name: jesler729
text: Deep down, we all feel pretty bad that we don't know very much about piano music.

name: poodlelucy
text: i know a lot about piano music, but i feel bad not knowing more. and i agree, it IS important to understand piano music.  1, alt text.

name: hereward
text: Note that the telesales says the CDs are 19.99 each for 5, which probably means the total price is $100. The cold callers of hell are merciless.

name: vice
text:
Unless its $19.99 per masterpeice.

Phillipe, you knew you were gonna have to pay for these masterpeices eventually.

name: tekende
text: No, he didn't!

name: panthera3000
text: Chubby for the early reference

name: peterjoel
text: Philippe has no way of getting any money, ever.

name: vice
text: Maybe he should commit SUICIDE

name: zapatos
text: oh my gosh, a stranger!

name: i_love_kate
text: Roast Beef's paw on the glass of the telephone booth makes it.

name: wittyname
text: Agreed, its like he's reaching out to Phillipe and only getting cold glass. The expression on his face is also fantastic. One of the comics that is funny yet touching in the same panel.

name: deusoma
text: Yeah, it's like he's in a glass box of emotion.

name: stormagnet
text: It's always the final panel that makes it.

name: aliiis
text: Yes. Also with the slight stuttering, 'O-okay' all hesitating with a lump rising up in his throat. It makes me want to actually cry.

name: i_love_kate
text: You can cry if you want, Aliiis. You are among friends here.

name: unprotected
text: Nah.  Honestly I just think he's a little weirded out that Phillipe is acting all weird to him.

name: slalvation
text: I think maybe this is my favorite Achewood.

name: echidnaboy
text: Beef's non-standard punctuation suits him so well. Those dangling exclamation marks look so fragile. There are plenty of comics characters (e.g. Sandman) with distinctive typefaces and/or speech bubble designs, but few whose (mis)use of punctuation helps define their personality. This is one of the things which raises Achewood into the upper echelons of the medium.

name: echidnaboy
text: Sorry, that nearly turned into an essay. "Discuss, with appropriate examples, the use of non-standard punctuation and typographical devices as a means toward character development in sequential art, with particular emphasis on online media (8,500 - 10,000 words, plus appendices)."

name: dicklaurent
text: This is a lot like talking to someone who's trippin' balls, and everything you tell them takes on a real subjective and distorted meaning, followed by an answer based on that delusion. Except in this case, Philippe is in fact talking to someone from hell (where the devil lives).

name: rothenbergxxx
text: The telephones in hell trick you into believing your friends are selfish and anti-social...

name: saucy_jack
text: This makes me laugh out loud every single time I read it.

name: atticusonline
text: i'm also one of the many who laughed out loud to the last panel...beef is so confused!

name: way
text: Am I the only one who noticed that Philippe never told telemarketer-Beef his address? Granted, Beef probably actually knows that information, but still. I would be freaked out.

name: genequagmire
text: These last couple of strips are complete genius.

name: serious_man
text: [IMGS OFF]
